intro: Aulacophyllum wallisii, commonly known as the Wallis's spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern ally that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with upright, spore-bearing cones at the tips of its segmented stems. Its leaves are small, linear, and arranged spirally around the stem. Aulacophyllum wallisii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
